v.v: Bel bows down, Nebo stoops; their idols
Together they bend low, kneel down; they cannot rescue the images,
Listen to me, house of Jacob, all the remnant of the house of Israel,
Even to your old age I am he, and until your hair is gray I will carry you.
To whom will you compare me? Who do you think I resemble, so that we may be compared?
People pour out gold from the bag and weigh silver on the scale.
They lift it on their shoulder and carry it; they set it in its place, and it stands in its place and does not move from it.
Think about these things; never ignore them, you rebels!
Think about the earlier things, those of times past,
I announce the end from the beginning, and beforehand what has not yet happened;
I call a bird of prey from the east, the man of my choice from a distant land;
Listen to me, you stubborn people, who are far from doing what is right.
I am bringing my righteousness near; it is not far away, and my salvation does not wait;

v: are carried by animals and beasts of burden. These idols that you carry are a heavy burden for weary animals.
and they themselves have gone off into captivity.
who have been carried by me from before your birth, carried from the womb.
I made you and I will bear you; I will carry you and I will rescue you.
They hire a metalsmith, and he makes it into a god; they bow down and worship it.
They cry out to it, but it cannot answer nor save anyone from his trouble.
for I am God, and there is no other, I am God, and there is no one like me.
I say, “My plan will happen, and I will do as I desire.”
yes, I have spoken; I will also accomplish it; I have purposed, I will also do it.
and I will give salvation to Zion and my beauty to Israel.
